pullRequest.title: Fixes #3766, Added OPENSTREET attribution
pullRequest.bodyText:
Description (required)
Fixes #3766
**What changes did you make and why?

Added custom attribution to open street map

Tests performed (required)
Tested betaDebug with API 27
Screenshots (for UI changes only)

commit.message:
Fixes #3766
* Added OPENSTREET attribution in nearby

nodes.bodyText: Referring to #3766 (comment) , I believe this should be OpenStreetMap (ODBL)
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -40,7 +40,19 @@
                 android:layout_height="match_parent"
                 android:background="@android:color/transparent" />
 
-        </FrameLayout>
+            <androidx.appcompat.widget.AppCompatTextView
+              android:id="@+id/tv_attribution"
+              android:layout_width="wrap_content"
+              android:layout_height="wrap_content"
+              android:layout_alignParentRight="true"
+              android:layout_alignParentBottom="true"
+              android:layout_margin="4dp"
+              android:text="© OPENSTREETMAP \n contributors"

commit.message: Added custom text attribution in Nearby

nodes.bodyText: I believe "Mapbox Telemetry" would be a better name for the setting. "Telemetry Opt In" coupled with the setting description sounds like were collection metrics for the whole app using Mapbox, which we're totally not doing.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -610,5 +610,6 @@ Upload your first media by tapping on the add button.</string>
   <string name="ask_to_turn_location_on">Turn on location?</string>
   <string name="nearby_needs_location">Nearby needs location enabled to work properly</string>
   <string name="use_location_from_similar_image">Did you shoot these two pictures at the same place? Do you want to use the latitude/longitude of the picture on the right?</string>
-
+  <string name="telemetry_opt_in">Telemetry Opt In</string>

nodes.bodyText: A better and concise description would be "Send anonymized location and usage data to Mapbox"
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -610,5 +610,6 @@ Upload your first media by tapping on the add button.</string>
   <string name="ask_to_turn_location_on">Turn on location?</string>
   <string name="nearby_needs_location">Nearby needs location enabled to work properly</string>
   <string name="use_location_from_similar_image">Did you shoot these two pictures at the same place? Do you want to use the latitude/longitude of the picture on the right?</string>
-
+  <string name="telemetry_opt_in">Telemetry Opt In</string>
+  <string name="telemetry_opt_in_summary">Mapbox Telemetry is a powerful location analytics platform included in this SDK. By default, the SDK sends anonymized location and usage data to Mapbox</string>

nodes.bodyText: It would be nice to rename these to clarify that it is "Opt Out" and not "Opt In".

I took a stab at trying to make this look smaller and still legible in my small-screen device and the following is what helped/satisfied me: Suggested change With map_attribution defined to the following in string.xml: Mapbox © OpenStreetMap Improve this map]]> Using CDATA, means we don't need ClickableSpan/SpannableString for the linking of the text. This has the advantage that the text clearly appears as a link and the code is readable. Note: To ensure that's not translated we would've to define it in a separate file for strings that don't get translated.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -40,7 +40,24 @@
                 android:layout_height="match_parent"
                 android:background="@android:color/transparent" />
 
-        </FrameLayout>
+            <androidx.appcompat.widget.AppCompatTextView
+              android:id="@+id/tv_attribution"

+              android:layout_height="wrap_content"
+              android:layout_alignParentLeft="true"
+              android:layout_alignParentBottom="true"
+              android:layout_margin="8dp"
+              android:text="©MapBox    ©OpenStreetMap \n Improve this map"
+              android:shadowColor="#000000"
+              android:shadowDx="2.5"
+              android:shadowDy="2.5"
+              android:shadowRadius="1.6"
+              android:textSize="14sp"
+              android:textColor="@android:color/white"
+              android:textAlignment="center"
+              android:textStyle="bold" />

nodes.bodyText: Perhaps it might help make this more palatable for users if we add when using "Nearby" feature at the end of this sentence. Sorry for the multiple reviews @ashishkumar468 , I just thought about this.
